title: Looe Island Walk Route

images.title: Paula Goodfellow / Looe Island
images.caption: Looe Island. Looking at Looe Island from a small boat off shore. The house was occupied by two maiden sisters for about 40 years till recently, now is being turned into a nature retreat. They donated it for such after their deaths.

images.title: Chris Downer / St. George’s or Looe Island
images.caption: St. George's or Looe Island

description: This delightful island of the Cornish coast is well worth a visit. You can catch a boat from East Looe during the summer months and then enjoy a 1km walk around the beautiful little island. It's a fantastic place for wildlife lovers with grey seals, cormorants, shags and oystercatchers to look out for. There's also wildflower meadows which attract different types of butterfly. Keep your eyes peeled for speckled wood, meadow brown and red admiral as you make your way across the meadows. The island also includes mix of grassland, scrub, woods and fabulous views back along the Cornish coast. The South West Coast Path runs through Looe so you could try the Looe to Polperro coastal walk to extend your walking in the area.
